newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy MIF futures market halves nominal BTP coupon.
newsitem.headline: Italy MIF futures market halves nominal BTP coupon.

text.p: The Italian futures market (MIF) said it is halving to 6 from 12 percent the nominal coupon on the Btp government bond futures contract.

The management committee of the Italian government bond secondary market (MTS) and the MIF futures market announced the decision in a statement after a meeting with representatives of the Treasury, the Bank of Italy and the Consob stock market regulatory authority.
The Treasury must now approve the measure.
The committee said it proposed introducing a six percent coupon on the June Btp contract soon. The existing 12 percent June contract will trade alongside the new contract until its own expiry.
But from the September expiry there will only be one future contract with a six percent nominal coupon.
